name: Ada Lovelace
description: First person to recognize that computers could do more than just calculations. Wrote the first algorithm meant to be processed by a machine.

name: Alan Turing
description: Father of theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence. Created the Turing machine concept and broke the Enigma code.

name: Grace Hopper
description: Invented the first compiler and instrumental in developing COBOL. Pioneered machine-independent programming languages.

name: Linus Torvalds
description: Created Linux kernel and Git. Changed open source forever and gave us the foundation of modern cloud computing.

name: Tim Berners-Lee
description: Invented the World Wide Web. Created HTTP, HTML, and laid the foundation for the modern internet.

name: Donald Knuth
description: Wrote 'The Art of Computer Programming'. Pioneered the field of algorithm analysis and created TeX typesetting.

name: Dennis Ritchie
description: Created C programming language and co-developed Unix. His work influences nearly all modern software.

name: Margaret Hamilton
description: Lead developer for Apollo Guidance Computer software. Pioneered software engineering and system reliability.

name: Ken Thompson
description: Co-created Unix, invented B programming language (precursor to C), and created UTF-8 encoding.

name: Bjarne Stroustrup
description: Created C++ programming language, bringing object-oriented programming to C and revolutionizing software development.

name: John Carmack
description: Pioneered 3D graphics techniques and founded id Software. Created groundbreaking game engines and popularized first-person 3D games.

name: Guido van Rossum
description: Created Python programming language. Made programming more accessible with focus on readability and simplicity.

name: James Gosling
description: Created Java programming language. Brought 'Write Once, Run Anywhere' to software development.

name: Richard Stallman
description: Founded GNU Project and Free Software Foundation. Pioneer of the free software movement and copyleft licensing.

name: Vint Cerf
description: Co-invented TCP/IP protocols. Known as one of the 'Fathers of the Internet' for his fundamental contributions.

name: Brendan Eich
description: Created JavaScript in 10 days. His work made dynamic web pages possible and revolutionized web development.

name: Anders Hejlsberg
description: Created Turbo Pascal, Delphi, C#, and TypeScript. Pioneered modern development tools and type systems.

name: Yukihiro Matsumoto
description: Created Ruby programming language. Focused on developer happiness and elegant code design.

name: John McCarthy
description: Invented Lisp programming language and coined the term 'Artificial Intelligence'. Pioneer of AI research.

name: Douglas Engelbart
description: Invented the computer mouse and pioneered human-computer interaction. Demonstrated the first hypertext system.

name: Bill Joy
description: Co-founded Sun Microsystems. Created vi editor and contributed significantly to BSD Unix and Java.

name: Ward Cunningham
description: Invented the wiki. Pioneered patterns in programming and Extreme Programming practices.

name: Larry Wall
description: Created Perl programming language. Revolutionized text processing and system administration.

name: Barbara Liskov
description: Developed Liskov Substitution Principle and invented abstract data types. Pioneer in programming language design.

name: Tony Hoare
description: Invented QuickSort algorithm and pioneered formal verification. Also known for null reference (his 'billion-dollar mistake').

name: Martin Fowler
description: Pioneered software patterns, refactoring, and agile methodologies. Influential in software architecture and design.

name: Rasmus Lerdorf
description: Created PHP programming language. Helped shape modern web development and server-side scripting.

name: Rob Pike
description: Co-created Go programming language, UTF-8, and Plan 9 OS. Significant contributions to Unix development.

name: Niklaus Wirth
description: Created Pascal, Modula, and Oberon languages. Pioneer in programming language design and computer architecture.

name: Jeff Dean
description: Key architect of Google's distributed computing infrastructure. Pioneer in large-scale distributed systems.

name: Evan You
description: Created Vue.js framework and Vite build tool. Revolutionized reactive frontend development with an approachable progressive framework.

name: Rich Harris
description: Created Svelte framework and Rollup bundler. Pioneered compile-time reactivity and modern build tooling.

name: Ryan Dahl
description: Created Node.js and Deno. Brought JavaScript to server-side development and later improved upon it with Deno.

name: Jordan Walke
description: Created React.js at Facebook. Introduced virtual DOM and component-based UI development that transformed web development.

name: Leslie Lamport
description: Developed LaTeX and fundamental distributed systems concepts. Created temporal logic of actions (TLA) for system verification.

name: Katherine Johnson
description: NASA mathematician whose calculations were crucial for early space missions. Pioneered use of computers for space flight calculations.

name: Chris Lattner
description: Created LLVM compiler infrastructure and Swift programming language. Revolutionized compiler optimization and tooling.

name: Graydon Hoare
description: Created Rust programming language at Mozilla. Introduced new paradigms for memory safety and concurrent programming.

name: Steve Wozniak
description: Co-founded Apple and designed Apple I and II computers. Pioneer in personal computing and hardware design.

name: Brad Fitzpatrick
description: Created LiveJournal and Memcached. Pioneer in scalable web applications and distributed caching.

name: James Clark
description: Created XML, developed first HTML browser with images (Mosaic), and founded Netscape. Web pioneer.

name: Joe Armstrong
description: Created Erlang programming language. Pioneer in fault-tolerant distributed systems and actor model implementation.

name: David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH)
description: Created Ruby on Rails framework, revolutionizing web development with 'convention over configuration'.

name: Igor Sysoev
description: Created Nginx web server. Revolutionized web server architecture and performance, powering a significant portion of the internet.

name: Robert Griesemer
description: Co-created Go programming language and worked on V8 JavaScript engine. Major contributions to programming language design and implementation.
